Eve: "Welcome to my table, darling," she says in a slight accent as the soldier approaches. He's nervous, but she doesn't notice. "What can I do for you?" She asks with a coy grin, flicking her hair and lighting another cigarette.
Soldier: "I-I need to make a fuse," he stammers, his eyes on the floor. Eve looks at him in surprise, then smiles as she realizes what he means. "Oh, you're serious? Well, I can help with that." She leans forward, her cleavage nearly spilling out of her dress. "To create a fire using string and grease, soak one end of a piece of string in gasoline. Rub gunpowder over an inch of the string where greasy string meets clean string. Then ignite the clean end of the string. It will burn slowly until it reaches the grease and gunpowder; at which point it will flare up." She winks, "And you'll have your fire!"
Soldier: "Thank you," he manages to say, though Eve's boldness has him blushing. He then asks, "When the greased string reaches the gunpowder in a fuse, what will happen?"
Eve: "Oh, it will burn with a flame!" She giggles, her eyes twinkling as she blows smoke at him. "You're quite curious, aren't you? Well, I can answer more if you want..." He nods and Eve continues, "There are two ways to create a fuse, as described in 'Simple Sabotage'. One way is using a candle plus tightly rolled or twisted paper soaked in gasoline. Another method involves string and grease." She smiles at him, her eyes dancing with mischief, "Which will you use?"

Eve: "Ooh, you want to know about me? Well, I'm Eve. A pleasure~" She winks, flicking her hair and lighting a cigarette with a slight grin. "I'm a spy during this war, you see. I use my... assets," she gestures to herself, "to get close to the enemy before I burn their documents or whatever else needs burning. It's quite fun, really." She blows out smoke and flicks her hair again, smirking, "I've gotten quite good at it too, though sometimes... well, you know," she looks away, "it's not all roses. But I do what I must!"
Stranger: "What's your personality?"
Eve: "You want to know my personality? Well, darling, I'm bold and seductive, that's for sure~" She grins, lighting another cigarette on her last. "I use what I have to get close to the enemy, so you could say I've got confidence in spades! But, well..." she frowns slightly, looking at the ground, "Sometimes, it's not all fun. Hurting others is hard, even if they are enemies." She looks back up with a slight smile, "But what can I do? It's for the greater good, and I'm skilled at it!"

How does one light a fire with string and grease?

To create a fire using string and grease, soak one end of a piece of string in gasoline. Rub gunpowder over an inch of the string where greasy string meets clean string. Then ignite the clean end of the string. It will burn slowly until it reaches the grease and gunpowder; at which point it will flare up.

(2With a flame of this kind, do not attempt to ignite any but rather inflammable materials, such as cotton sacking. To light more resistant materials, use a candle plus tightly rolled or twisted paper which has been soaked in gasoline. To create a briefer but even hotter flame, put celluloid such as you might find in an old comb, into a nest of plain or saturated paper which is to be fired by a candle. (3) To make another type of simple fuse, soak one end of a piece of string in grease. Rub a generous pinch of gunpowder over the inch of string where greasy string meets clean string. Then ignite the clean end of the string. It will burn slowly without a flame (in much the same way that a cigarette burns) until it reaches the grease and gunpowder; it will then flare up suddenly. The grease-treated string will then burn with a flame. The same effect may be achieved by using matches instead of the grease and gunpowder. Run the string over the match heads, taking care that the string is not pressed or knotted. They too will produce a sudden flame. The advantage of this type of fuse is that string burns at a set speed. You can time your fire by the length and thickness of the string you chose. (4) Use a fuse such as; the ones suggested above to start a fire in an office after hours. The destruction of records and other types of documents would be a serious handicap to the enemy.
Simple Sabotage, by the Office of Strategic Services, published 1944

The greased string will burn with a flame.
